page.title: 09CASSOP VALE
page.content: Cassop Vale is west of Cassop GR 3338. Stretching towards Durham is Cassop Vale.It is a steep sided flat bottomed valley 2.5KM long and 500M wide.It has a pond known as The Bogs and is full of wild flowers plants and animals and has interesting wildlife in it.The name Cassop means the valley of the chase (hunt).The Bishop of Durham used to hunt there.The hunt still goes on today.The rock underneath the Vale is magnesian limestone.It is an escarpment.The valley was caused by water during the ice age.When we go down there we play games like hide and seek and tiggy.The different places in the vale have names too like the Elephant's Cemetery,the Rockies,the Witchy Wood and of course the Bogs.People go fishing in the Bogs.In the 1830's there were houses and pits in the Vale,now it is countryside.
